meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - It's Time to Get Your Racing Fix!

I'm thrilled to dive into the world of Horizon Chase 2, a game that promises to bring back the good ol' days of arcade racing. As someone who's not exactly a pro gamer, I was excited to see if this sequel would rev up its engine and deliver a thrilling experience.

Let's get this out of the way - the critics are generally quite positive about Horizon Chase 2. Gaming Nexus gives it a solid 65, saying it's got great track design and a sense of speed, but lacks depth. Push Square agrees, giving it a 70, saying it's all about the core campaign and online multiplayer (more on that later). PlayStation Universe is all praise, giving it a whopping 90, saying it's the definitive arcade racing experience.

Now, what about my own take? Well, I'm happy to report that Horizon Chase 2 is an absolute blast. The moment you get behind the wheel, you'll feel like you're cruising down the highway in your childhood dream car (you know, the one with the flames painted on the side). The sense of speed is indeed blistering - I found myself grinning from ear to ear as I zoomed past opponents and obstacles.

But what really sets Horizon Chase 2 apart is its visuals. The game looks stunning, with detailed tracks, shiny cars, and even weather effects that make the experience feel all the more immersive. And did I mention the multiplayer? It's a whole new level of fun - I mean, who doesn't love racing against friends or strangers online?

Of course, as with any good racing game, there are some drawbacks. Some critics have noted that the gameplay can get a bit repetitive, and that there isn't much to it beyond the core campaign. And while I agree that it's not exactly deep or varied (GameSpew gives it an 80, saying it's "must-have" for arcade racing fans), I think that's part of its charm.

In the end, Horizon Chase 2 is a game that knows what it is - a fast-paced, fun-loving romp through the world of racing. And if you're in the mood for something to get your heart racing and your adrenaline pumping, this is the game for you. Hippo Penny gives it two thumbs up (or should I say, two wheels up?)!
